Dear Sirs, s.s, tt Ockenfels n 'Rotenfels n 'Baltistan' In reference to your letter No, 1/1468 dated 31st December 1938, this is to inform you that this Government grants permission for the abovenentioned vessels to anchor at Sitrah terminal buoy for the purpose of discharging the car^o consigned to the Bahrain petroleum Company Limited and the Bahrain Refinery Company, provided that only working material for the Bahrain Petroleum Company and the Bahrain Refinery Company is landed at Sitrah and that duti able and other cargo, including personal effects, is discharged at Manamah Customs as usual. Yours faithfully. a Adviser to the Government. Copy to: H. B..M f s Political Agent, Bahrain. Tne Director of Customs and Port Officer,Bhn,f fell I**' THE BAHREIN PETROLEUM COMPANY LIMITED Awali, Bahrein Island, Persian Gulf, Januairy 4, 1939 J'fa f no.pa-96 His Britannic Majesty t s BDlitical Agent, BAHREIN, Dear Sir, I enclose seven copies of each of the following Royalty Delivery Tickets R.233-B, R.234, R.235, R.236, R.237, R.238, R.239, R»240, R.241. These Tickets represent the total amount of Crude Oil run from Tanks Nos. 152 and 153 to the Refinery and include Arabian Crude run from Zellaq., which has been com puted on the Ibllowing Royalty Delivery Tickets, seven copies of each being enclosed z .65, z .66, z .67, z .68, z .69, z .70, Z.71, z .72, z .73, z^, z .75, z *76, z .77, z .78, z .79, z .80, z .81, z .82, z .83, z .84, z .85, z .86, z .87, z .88, z .89, z .90, z .91, The difference between the totals of these two sets of Royalty Delivery Tickets represents the total gross amount of Crude Oil upon which the Royalty for December 1938 will be accrued. 'LIGHTENFliLS' ' TUMIST a N' and 'REICHiiNFliLS'. f > « h In reference to your letter No. l/99 dated 6th itebruary 1939 ? this is to inform that this Goremiaent grants penaission for the abovementioned vessels to anchor at Sitrah terminal buoy for the purpose of discharging the cargo consigned to the Bahrain Petroleum Comnany Limited and the Bahrain Refinery Company, provided tnat only working material for the Bahrain Petroleum Company and the Bahrain Refinery Company is landed at Sitrah and that dutiable and other cargo, including personal effects, is discharged at the iAanamah Customs as usual. Bahi'ein Government, ^ rr BAHREIN. — Vs Dear Sir, SS^'MILL HILL' The above steamer is expected to arrive here tomorrow the 6th instant, and we hereby apply for permission to enable her to proceed to Sitra for a is charge of the Bapco there. Commercial cargo, if any, will be brought round to the Customs Pier at Manama, as usual. Gray, Mackenzie and Company Limited. Bahrain. s.s.*Mill Hill w . Dear Sirs. * In reference to your letter No. L/196 dated 5th March 1939, this is to inform you that this Crovemment grants permission for s.s. 'Mill Hill' to anchor at Sitrah terminal buoy for the purpose of discharging the cargo consigned to the Bahrain Petroleum Company and the Bahrain Refinery Company, provided that only working material for the Bahrain Petroleum Company and the Bahrain Refinery Company is landed at Sitrah and that dutiable and other cargo, including personal effects, is discharged at the Manamah Customs as usual* Yours faithfully, Adviser to the Government. Copy toi- H. B. M 1 s Political Agent, Bahrain.^ The Director of Customs & Port Officer, Bn. R.Z.No. 412-28/5 zz Political Agency, ' Bahrain, the 12th I's^rch 1939. To 1. The Adviser to the Bahrain Government, Bahrain. 2. Messrs. Gray, Mackenzie & Co. Ltd., Bahrain. 'einorandun . I am directed to say that the Political Agent does not now think it necessary for the Agency to receive copies of correspondence relating to permission for steamers to discharge at Sitrah, in ordinary circumstances. . ■■ - Assistant Political Agent, Bahrain.THE BAHREIN PETROLEUM COMPANY LIMITED Affall, Bahrein Island, Persian Gulf. March 4, 1939. No.PA-172 His Britannic Majesty's Political Agent, - BAHREIN. location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: 'File 28/5 IV Visits of Tankers and Steamers etc. to Sitrah terminus'

physicalDescription.extent: The documents in the file are arranged in chronological order. There are notes at the end of the file, (folios 334-336). The file notes are arranged chronologically and refer to documents within the file; they give a brief description of the correspondence with a reference number, which refers back to that correspondence in the file.
The foliation is in pencil in the top right corner, it starts on the first folio of writing with 1 and ends on 337, which is the last number given on the back cover.

mods.abstract: The file mainly contains Royalty Delivery Tickets showing the amount of oil shipped from January to May 1939, transmitted by the Political Agent at Bahrain to the Secretary of State for India and the Political Resident in the Gulf.
